Text: thanks for the up, i'm a nerd for comparing different copies of beatles tracks..but just so you're aware, 'deccagone' is a bootleg label and this is probably just a vinyl pressing of the anthology tracks.  bootlegzone doesn't have any release years listed for these 45s so i can't say for sure.
These are gems, but if you don't mind a suggestion would be even better if ripped at a higher bitrate or lossless.

Deccagone â€“ PRO-1100
Vinyl, 7", 45 RPM, Single, Mono, Unofficial Release, Blue
Released:1976

On January 1st 1962, The Beatles recorded 15 tracks at the Decca studios for their first English record company audition. In 1976 a series of unofficial singles came out on colored vinyl with picture sleeves.
